latest news.eng_title: OpenAI Seeks New Funding Round to Reach $100 Billion Valuation
latest news.summary: OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT, is reportedly seeking a new funding round that could value the company at $100 billion. According to Bloomberg sources, OpenAI has been in talks with Thrive Capital and Microsoft since December to raise around $1 billion. This would be in addition to the $86 billion valuation achieved through an employee stock sale earlier this year. OpenAI's financial situation is complex, with the company reportedly losing billions of dollars annually despite generating significant revenue from ChatGPT and its AI models. However, the company's revenue is growing, driven by the success of its GPT-4o model and its partnership with Apple. As Apple's Siri and other iOS features will integrate ChatGPT, this could lead to increased adoption and revenue for OpenAI.
latest news.title: OpenAI atteindrait bientôt une valorisation exceptionnelle de 100 milliards de dollars

latest news.eng_title: ChatGPT maker OpenAI may launch ‘Project Strawberry' in fall: Why this may be a big deal
latest news.summary: OpenAI may launch its advanced AI project, 'Strawberry' (previously known as Q*), later this year. According to The Information, researchers have aimed to launch the new AI as part of a chatbot, possibly within ChatGPT, as soon as this fall. 'Strawberry' can autonomously navigate the internet for 'deep research' and solve problems that today's chatbots cannot reliably do, including math problems it has never been trained on. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman posted a picture of strawberries earlier this month, which was seen as a hint about Project Strawberry. The technology has been demonstrated to American national security officials and is reportedly a 'tightly kept secret'.
latest news.title: ChatGPT maker OpenAI may launch ‘Project Strawberry' in fall: Why this may be a big deal

latest news.eng_title: OpenAI's Project Strawberry will become ChatGPT5, launch soon, and be better at math than any chatbot, insiders say
latest news.summary: OpenAI's secretive Project Strawberry, which will become ChatGPT5, is expected to be released soon, possibly in Fall 2024. According to insiders, the project will specialize in areas such as math and programming, and will be better at solving math problems and programming challenges than any chatbot before it. This is a welcome improvement, given ChatGPT's previous struggles with math. The project's scope is broader than just math, and it has been demonstrated to be capable of advanced levels of thinking, such as solving complex puzzles like the New York Times Connections. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman had previously hinted at the project's existence with a cryptic tweet about strawberries. If Project Strawberry is not integrated into ChatGPT5, its ability to produce higher-quality data could be used to create training data for OpenAI's next LLM, which would help reduce hallucinations. The project's release may be accompanied by a smaller version of it becoming part of ChatGPT in ChatGPT 5.
latest news.title: OpenAI's Project Strawberry will become ChatGPT5, launch soon, and be better at math than any chatbot, insiders say

latest news.eng_title: OpenAI Close to Releasing Strawberry AI on ChatGPT; 'Orion' Could Be GPT-5
latest news.summary: OpenAI is reportedly preparing to integrate the Strawberry AI engine into ChatGPT, which could launch as early as this fall. Strawberry can solve complex math and programming problems, perform in-depth research, plan, and generate high-quality synthetic data. Additionally, OpenAI is training the successor of GPT-4/4o, codenamed 'Orion', which could be the next GPT-5 model. According to sources, OpenAI has already demoed Strawberry to US national security officials, who were reportedly impressed by its ability to solve the New York Times 'Connections' word puzzle. As The Information notes, Strawberry's approach is similar to the STaR (Self-Taught Reasoner) technique proposed by Stanford researchers, which can significantly improve reasoning capability. 'Orion' is expected to be trained on high-quality synthetic data generated by Strawberry.
latest news.title: OpenAI Close to Releasing Strawberry AI on ChatGPT; 'Orion' Could Be GPT-5

latest news.eng_title: OpenAI Preparing New AI, Strawberry, for ChatGPT This Fall
latest news.summary: OpenAI is preparing to launch a new artificial intelligence, codenamed Strawberry, which may become part of ChatGPT this fall. Strawberry, previously known as Q*, has advanced mathematical and programming skills that surpass current market solutions. The improved version of Strawberry will also be used to train a new generation of GPT-4 models, known as Orion. OpenAI aims to have AI that maintains the same level of performance as the larger model, but is cheaper and easier to use. With synthetic data that Strawberry can create, OpenAI hopes to improve the quality of training data for its models and reduce errors. A less powerful version of Strawberry is expected to be released this fall, but the exact release date is unknown.
latest news.title: OpenAI готовит новый искусственный интеллект Strawberry для ChatGPT этой осенью

latest news.eng_title: OpenAI Aims to Release New AI Model, ‘Strawberry,' in Fall
latest news.summary: OpenAI aims to release its new AI model, 'Strawberry,' in the fall, which will be able to solve complex problems and tasks beyond the capabilities of current AI models. According to Seeking Alpha, Strawberry will be able to solve math problems it has never encountered, perform high-level tasks like developing market strategies, and perform 'deep research.' This is part of OpenAI's pursuit of human-level reasoning, as stated by Ghazenfer Mansoor, founder and CEO of Technology Rivers, 'OpenAI's pursuit of human-level reasoning isn't just a technological marvel; it's a narrative of pushing boundaries and sparking new possibilities in every sector.' OpenAI has recently launched several new products, including an advanced voice feature for ChatGPT, a new SearchGPT tool, and a smaller, more affordable iteration of ChatGPT called GPT-4o mini.
latest news.title: OpenAI Aims to Release New AI Model, ‘Strawberry,' in Fall

latest news.eng_title: ChatGPT and GPT-4 could get a sweet upgrade this fall
latest news.summary: OpenAI is planning to launch a new AI, codenamed Strawberry, as part of a chatbot this fall. Strawberry has advanced math-solving and programming skills that are not found in other large language models (LLMs). A larger version of Strawberry is being used to improve the successor to GPT-4, codenamed Orion. The smaller version of Strawberry is expected to be a simplified version of the AI, with the goal of maintaining the same level of performance while being cheaper and easier to operate. According to The Information, it's unclear if this version of Strawberry will provide any performance boosts to ChatGPT or GPT-4 this year. However, the AI could help OpenAI's problem with obtaining enough real-world data for its LLMs, and it has already been shown off to American national security officials. 'We'll have to wait to find out the date and if this add-on will give OpenAI a step up on its rivals,' the article states.
latest news.title: ChatGPT and GPT-4 could get a sweet upgrade this fall

latest news.eng_title: The War for Artificial Intelligence: A Fierce Competition
latest news.summary: The war for artificial intelligence (AI) is a fierce competition between the world's leading technological powers. OpenAI, Anthropic, Microsoft, Apple, Google, and many others are redefining the limits of what is possible. OpenAI's GPT-5 promises significant improvements in language understanding and generation, while Anthropic's Claude is a leader in safe and human-aligned AI. Microsoft's Copilot is transforming productivity, and Apple's Apple Intelligence is integrating AI into its devices. Google's Bard is reimagining search, and DeepMind is advancing AI research. IBM Watson is using AI for medical diagnosis, and NVIDIA's Clara is transforming AI in computing graphics and data science. Salesforce's Einstein is introducing AI capabilities in its CRM platform, and Cohere and Hugging Face are democratizing access to advanced NLP tools. Palantir's Foundry is using AI for data analysis, and Amazon's SageMaker is making AI accessible to all. Baidu and Alibaba are leading the charge in AI in Asia, and Jasper AI and Rasa are specializing in content creation and chatbots. X.AI is exploring AI generativity, and the war for AI is far from over. The future of AI is in specialization and deep integration into all aspects of human life. The question is no longer if AI will dominate, but how it will and who will be in charge.
latest news.title: La Batalla por la Inteligencia Artificial

news knowledge.eng_title: No GPT-5 Presentation at DevDay 2024: What to Expect
news knowledge.summary: OpenAI has announced that the DevDay 2024 will change its format and will be a series of on-the-road sessions instead of a single event. The sessions will take place in San Francisco on October 1, London on October 30, and Singapore on October 21. According to a spokesperson for OpenAI, 'we don't intend to announce our next model at DevDay. We'll focus more on training developers on what's available and showcasing community developer stories.' The events will include workshops, breakout sessions, product demos, and developer meetups. The cost to attend is $450, but eligible participants may attend for free. The development status of the upcoming GPT-5 model remains unclear.
news knowledge.title: Per GPT-5 c'è da attendere: niente presentazione al DevDay 2024. Slitta al 2025?

news knowledge.eng_title: OpenAI tempers expectations with less bombastic, GPT-5-less DevDay this fall
news knowledge.summary: OpenAI is scaling back its DevDay conference this fall, shifting from a major press event to a series of on-the-road developer engagement sessions. The company will not release its next major flagship model, GPT-5, during DevDay, instead focusing on updates to its APIs and developer services. According to an OpenAI spokesperson, 'We're not planning to announce our next model at DevDay. We'll be focused more on educating developers about what's available and showcasing dev community stories.' OpenAI is prioritizing incremental improvements to its tools, rather than monumental leaps, and is facing challenges in finding high-quality training data due to increasing access restrictions. The company is reportedly hemorrhaging billions of dollars training its models and hiring top-paid research staff, and still faces controversies surrounding AI safety and the use of copyrighted data.
news knowledge.title: OpenAI tempers expectations with less bombastic, GPT-5-less DevDay this fall

news knowledge.eng_title: ChatGPT-5 rumors: Release date, features, price, and more
news knowledge.summary: OpenAI is reportedly working on ChatGPT-5, the next major update to its flagship AI platform. While the official release date has not been announced, rumors suggest it could arrive as early as late 2024 or early 2025. ChatGPT-5 is expected to feature improved conversational skills, better language processing, improved contextual understanding, more personalization, stronger safety features, and more. OpenAI has confirmed that a new version of ChatGPT is in development, with CEO Sam Altman stating that it will be a 'significant leap forward' and resolve many of the errors in GPT-4. Altman also hinted that GPT-5 will have better reasoning capabilities, make fewer mistakes, and be useful for a 'much wider variety of tasks' compared to previous models. OpenAI has not indicated that its subscription pricing will change with GPT-5, so paid subscribers will likely get first access to the new model. However, users who access ChatGPT with Apple's upcoming feature, Apple Intelligence, may get free access to GPT-5 without an additional subscription. Safety and security will be top priorities for ChatGPT-5, with OpenAI doubling down on its commitment to improve safety and transparency. The company may also launch more third-party integrations with ChatGPT-5, making it a more useful tool for businesses.
news knowledge.title: ChatGPT-5 rumors: Release date, features, price, and more

news knowledge.eng_title: GPT-5: The Next Frontier in the AI Arms Race
news knowledge.summary: The tech world is eagerly awaiting the release of GPT-5, the next iteration of OpenAI's groundbreaking language model. According to Hamish Low of Enders Analysis, 'If OpenAI can deliver technology that matches its ambitious vision for what AI can be, it will be transformative for its own prospects, but also the economy more broadly.' However, the stakes are high, and OpenAI must continue to push the boundaries of AI to justify its investment and maintain its leadership position. The company faces a daunting challenge in delivering a superior product while addressing growing concerns about AI's impact on society, such as bias, misinformation, and job displacement. The outcome of GPT-5's release will shape the future of AI for years to come.
news knowledge.title: GPT-5: The Next Frontier in the AI Arms Race

news knowledge.eng_title: OpenAI's GPT-5 is coming out soon. Here's what to expect, according to OpenAI customers and developers.
news knowledge.summary: OpenAI is set to release its latest model, GPT-5, which is expected to be more powerful than its predecessor, GPT-4. However, some potential customers are skeptical about the new model's capabilities, with one CEO saying it may not feel like a 'big' change. Others are excited about the potential for GPT-5 to take on more complex tasks, such as reviewing legal documents and analyzing evidence. The model's ability to work with audio, video, and text interchangeably is also seen as a major advantage. However, the added cost of the new model may be a barrier for some developers, who are increasingly competing on price rather than performance.
news knowledge.title: OpenAI's GPT-5 is coming out soon. Here's what to expect, according to OpenAI customers and developers.

news knowledge.eng_title: OpenAI Prepares Ground for GPT-5: CEO Promises 'Significant Leap' in Technology
news knowledge.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman expects the GPT-5 to represent a 'significant leap' in technology compared to the GPT-4, although he also warned that there is still much work to be done. The GPT-5 is the most anticipated launch in generative AI, both for consumers and companies using the API. Altman promises to overcome many of the current limitations of the GPT-4 and open up new possibilities for application in various fields, gaining intelligence and response capacity. The GPT-5 is expected to have notable improvements in reasoning and reliability, multimodal capabilities, and the possibility of introducing autonomous AI agents. The launch is planned for late 2024 or early 2025. Altman compared the process to the development of the first iPhone, saying 'it still had bugs, but it was good enough to be useful'. The current ChatGPT will be 'ridiculously bad' compared to what will be seen in the next 12 months, a clear reference to the leap the GPT-5 will imply.
news knowledge.title: OpenAI prepara terreno para o GPT-5: CEO promete "salto significativo" em tecnologia

news knowledge.eng_title: Founder of OpenAI claims ChatGPT-5 will 'leave the competition in ridicule'
news knowledge.summary: Sam Altman, CEO and founder of OpenAI, stated that the next generation of their artificial intelligence program, ChatGPT, will represent a significant advancement compared to current versions, and 'leave the competition in ridicule'. Altman expects GPT-5 to correct many of the deficiencies of GPT-4, particularly in areas of reasoning and avoiding trivial errors. He also believes the new version will be much more advanced and useful for a wider range of tasks. This is not the first time Altman has referred to GPT-5 as a drastic improvement. Previously, he had dismissed GPT-4, calling it 'a mess' compared to its successor, and suggested that in the future we would remember it as 'the stupidest AI we've ever used'. Although there is no official release date for the new version of OpenAI's artificial intelligence model, it is speculated to be available in 2025. If the company has only just begun training, there is still a long way to go before its implementation in ChatGPT and other tools.
news knowledge.title: Fundador de OpenAI afirma que ChatGPT-5 dejará 'en ridículo' al resto de IA

news knowledge.eng_title: GPT-5: OpenAI Announces a Giant Leap in AI Technology
news knowledge.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has announced that GPT-5 will be a 'giant leap' compared to GPT-4. According to Altman, GPT-4 is limited in its capabilities, making mistakes that even a 6-year-old child would not make. He believes that GPT-5 will be much more capable of reasoning and will be able to automate a growing number of jobs. The training of GPT-5 has officially begun, with a planned release date of late 2024 or early 2025. Altman emphasized the importance of deploying AI iteratively and preparing the public for the true revolution in generative AI that is coming.
news knowledge.title: GPT-5 : OpenAI annonce un bond de géant ! Voici à quoi s'attendre

news knowledge.eng_title: New AI Model to Bring 'Significant Leap', Says OpenAI CEO Sam Altman
news knowledge.summary: Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, stated that the new AI model, successor to GPT-4, will bring a 'significant leap'. He revealed that the new model will solve many of the current AI's problems, adding that the company is still unsure about the advancements brought by GPT-5, which is still without an official name. Altman mentioned that GPT-4 makes some mistakes, such as not being able to reason well and sometimes making silly errors. He hopes that the new model will be much better in this sense and can be used for a wider range of useful tasks. According to Altman, the technology is still in its early stages of development. He compared it to the first iPhone, which had many bugs but was still useful for people. GPTs are language models created by OpenAI that can generate natural and fluent responses to written commands. The free version of ChatGPT currently uses GPT-3.5, which only has data up to September 2021. Those who pay for ChatGPT have access to GPT-4, which provides more accurate responses and better understands the prompts provided. The new model is expected to be quite powerful, providing more complete responses and understanding more complex commands. Mira Murati, OpenAI's technology director, compared GPT-3 to a child's intelligence, GPT-4 to a high school student's intelligence, and the upcoming model to a PhD's intelligence for specific tasks. The release date of the new model is still unknown, but expectations are high due to the company's innovative power.
news knowledge.title: • Novo ChatGPT deve trazer 'salto significativo', diz Sam Altman

news knowledge.eng_title: GPT-5: OpenAI's Next Language Model Promises Significant Improvements
news knowledge.summary: OpenAI is preparing the release of GPT-5, its next language model. According to CEO Sam Altman, this new model promises to be a significant improvement over its predecessor, GPT-4, addressing many of its limitations and solving errors in the current system. The advancements will bring substantial improvements in reasoning and reliability, as well as multimodal capabilities that include not only text but also images and video. These improvements aim to expand the possibilities of generative AI in various fields, offering smarter and more precise responses. GPT-5 is still in development, with no official release date yet, but expected to be released between late 2024 and early 2025. Altman compared the development of GPT-5 to the early days of the iPhone, highlighting that despite its initial imperfections, these technological advancements were revolutionary enough to transform the way we interact with technology. He also warned about the need to moderate expectations around the new language model, recalling how the release of GPT-4 generated high expectations that were only partially met, revealing persistent limitations in generative AI technology. However, the promise of a 'significant leap' with GPT-5 suggests that OpenAI is determined to overcome these technical barriers and offer a product that gives AI many more tools to transform the development of everyday and more complex technologies.
news knowledge.title: Revelan las primeras características de GPT-5, la IA que quiere parecerse más al humano
